-[John] What? -We have some issues we've got to discuss.
[John] No talk.
[man] You are aware of the fact that someone
was killed on your property yesterday, correct?
[John] Yeah, listen, I've got some diplomatic papers to go over...
[man] Okay... [stutters] that's fine...
There's a lot of people here that are concerned about your welfare.
You're a well-respected man, as far as I know, and have always been.
And I'd like to help resolve this with you.
[John] I will make no deal. [man] No deal?
translation.ko: - 협상은 하지 않아 - 협상을 안 하신다고요?

I'm in charge around here and that's the way it's going to be.
[man] We have to... we have to discuss the fact...
I don't want to talk about your diplomatic papers.

translation.en: [John] You have no right to tell a head-of-state what to do.
[man] We keep skipping over the issue. We have to get to the issue at hand.

translation.en: [John] The issue at hand is an international war is about to be had. So...
translation.ko: 해결해야 할 문제는 곧 일어날 국제 전쟁이야

translation.en: I'm not leaving this house right for the moment until I'm through.
translation.ko: 일을 마무리하기 전에는 한 발짝도 안 나갈 거야

translation.en: [narrator] The John E. du Pont story begins here in the rolling woodland of Pennsylvania,
on a 1,000-acre estate
that the du Pont family have called home for three quarters of a century.
Nestling among the trees
are the purpose-built headquarters of Team Foxcatcher.
translation.ko: 폭스캐처 팀을 위해 지은 본부가 자리하고 있습니다

translation.en: [reporter 1] Team Foxcatcher was the brain child of John du Pont approximately 30 years ago.
translation.ko: 폭스캐처 팀은 존 듀폰이 30여 년 전에 만들어냈죠

translation.en: In that time, John supported swimming, triathlon, pentathlon
translation.ko: 당시 존은 수영 철인 3종 경기, 5종 경기

translation.en: and many number of athletes
translation.ko: 그 외 다양한 운동 경기를 지원해서

translation.en: in all their endeavors to be world and Olympic champions.
translation.ko: 세계 및 올림픽 챔피언 양성에 힘썼습니다

translation.en: My goal is to teach the youth of America...

translation.en: not only to become champions in sport, but to become champions in life.
Thank you.
I'd like to draw your attention to the double doors where most of you entered...
where Mr. John du Pont will do the official ribbon cutting.
Let me congratulate John du Pont

translation.ko: 존 듀폰 씨께 축하 말씀을 전합니다

translation.ko: 근데 그게 조금 더 악화한 것 같아요

translation.en: [Brian Dolph] He would actually videotape the woods across the field
translation.ko: 존이 숲을 영상으로 찍은 적이 있는데

translation.en: and he would tape it for hours on end.
And then he'd sit and watch it, this still picture of the woods,
translation.ko: 그리고 정지화면 같은 영상을 앉아서 계속 보더니

translation.en: and he would try to get people to buy into things he was seeing in the woods.
translation.ko: 숲 속에 뭔가 보인다며 사람들의 동의를 구하는 거예요

translation.en: [Trevor] "Okay, look at that. Tell me, do you see something moving in there?"
translation.ko: ‘저길 좀 봐, 뭔가 움직이는 게 보여?’

translation.en: And you'd say no and he'd...
He'd get a little frustrated, you know, and then he'd fast forward.
"All right, now look at this, this is where it is."
You know, "Look, look at this. Do you see something moving?"
Or, "Do you see this?
Do you see a shape in there, or a form in there?"
And you'd... "No."
[Guira] I thought maybe it's a psychological game he's playing.
translation.ko: 심리 게임 같은 걸 하는 건가 싶었어요

translation.en: Or maybe it's just a power trip on his part, like,
"I wanna see if they'll just follow me and believe something."
translation.ko: 자신이 보인다고 하면 다들 그걸 믿는지 보려는 거요

translation.en: You know, when you're in that moment, situation,
you're like... "Are you serious?" You know? [chuckles]
You can't just nod because, sometimes, he would mean it in psychosis or whatever.
translation.ko: 그저 끄덕일 수만은 없는 게 가끔은 정신병인 것 같거든요

translation.en: But other times, he would bait you.
He'd look out over the field and say, "You see those deer?
translation.ko: 들판을 보며 이렇게 말해요 ‘저기 사슴들 보여?’

translation.en: They're really people dressed up as deer.
They're mechanical deer and someone's planting them there."
And if you say, "Oh, yeah, John, I see what you mean,"
translation.ko: 만약 그런 것 같다고 수긍하면 이렇게 말해요

translation.en: he'll say, "No, they're not! They're really deer!"
[Ed] There were guys that fueled his paranoia, you know,
"Oh, yeah, maybe I see it."
You know, those kind of comments would just get him to go even farther.
translation.ko: 그럼 존의 상태는 더 심각해지기만 했고요

translation.en: I generally went somewhat along with it, to a degree,
just because my position was not one of great security. [chuckles]
Whereas Dave Schultz,
being, in my opinion, the truest friend John had,
translation.ko: 저는 그가 존의 진정한 친구였다고 보는데

translation.en: would not agree.
[Larry] Some of the guys who stayed at Foxcatcher developed an affection for John.
translation.ko: 일부 폭스캐처 선수는 존에게 애착을 갖기 시작했어요

translation.en: And Dave, probably more than anybody.
Dave genuinely liked John and tried to help him.
translation.ko: 데이브는 진정으로 존을 좋아했고 도우려 했죠

translation.en: [Humphrey] We'd take turns staying with John, kind of watching him and making sure he was okay.
translation.ko: 우리는 돌아가며 존이 무사한지를 지켜보곤 했어요

translation.en: We'd do it in shifts, you know. Like, I'd leave at, like, 9:30,
and after the kids would go to sleep, Dave and Valo would come up
translation.ko: 데이브와 발렌틴이 아이들이 잠든 후 와서

translation.en: and they'd hang out at the big house until, like, 11:00.
It was very benign. You'd just sit over there and watch television,
or you'd go down and play pool.
It was an on-going process where he was helping us... be wrestlers,
and we were trying to help him... to be social.
translation.ko: 우리는 존이 사람들과 잘 어울리도록 도왔죠

translation.en: And, you know, that's kind of the way I always looked at it.
[Larry] You know, I felt sorry for John because he was so needy.
translation.ko: 전 존이 안타까웠어요 워낙 정에 굶주렸거든요

translation.en: [Trevor] He would obsess on people and sort of wanna be around that person most of the time.
translation.ko: 누군가에게 집착하면 계속 그 사람과 어울리려 했죠

translation.en: So, you know, when I came, I think it was probably Robbie.
translation.ko: 제가 왔을 때 그 대상은 로비였어요

translation.en: Um, Dave was that person, I think, you know, while he was there.
translation.ko: 데이브가 온 이후로는 데이브가 그 대상인듯했고요

translation.en: And Dan, the same kind of thing with Dan. You know, he'd really want to have Dan around.
translation.ko: 댄도 마찬가지였어요 댄과 함께 지내고 싶어 했죠

translation.en: Towards the end of the time I was there, it was Valentin.
[Chaid] How you doing today, Eagle?
Super. I'm ready.
[Chaid] Here's an optimist. Always ready for a little action.
How you doing, Valo?
-Good. -Good.
I'm ready for Eagle.
-Are you ready for Eagle? -Yes.
I don't know.
[Trevor] Like, I'd be over at the big house
and he'd be like, "Okay, time to go. Valentin's coming."
translation.ko: 존이 이렇게 말했죠 ‘발렌틴이 올 테니 가 봐’

translation.en: Sort of imply that "You leave now and Valentin's gonna sit down,
translation.ko: 제가 떠나면 그 자리에 발렌틴이 앉아서

translation.en: and I'm gonna hang with him."
-[Chaid] Hey, Valo. -What's up, Dan?
-You ready? -Yep.
[Trevor] There was a lot of Valentin, you know.
And the more he would obsess over Valentin, the more he would obsess over this whole, uh,
"I'm a Bulgarian."
[Larry] John started sponsoring the Bulgarian team.
And he decided that he originally was Bulgarian.
He was a descendent of whomever.
[Trevor] I was like, "No, you're not. You're not Bulgarian. [chuckling] You guys are French.
You're one of the most famous French families in the world."
[Trevor] He'd have none of that, you know.
"No, no, this is why I identify with Valentin,
because of my Bulgarian heritage."
[Nancy] John was frustrated, very frustrated,
because he wanted to be very close with Valentin Jordanov.
translation.ko: 발렌틴 요다노프와 정말 가까워지고 싶어 했거든요

translation.en: And Dave and Valo were very, very good friends.
So, I think there was a big jealousy of Dave.
translation.ko: 그래서 데이브를 많이 질투했던 것 같아요

translation.en: [Valentin in Bulgarian] The last year there was noticeable tension.
translation.ko: 마지막 해에는 눈에 띄게 긴장감이 돌았어요

translation.en: It was...
like that. I can't tell you...
what was in his head.
[Dave chuckling] He can't talk. He's confused.
[Chaid chuckles] He's... He is. He's so--
I don't know if he's mad or not. -[Dave] We communicate telepathically. -Don't be mad, John.
translation.ko: - 화나신 건지 잘 모르겠네 - 우린 텔레파시로 소통해요

translation.en: [Chaid] Come on, man, don't be mad at me.
I just gotta get a little tape-work here.
We sign in Bulgarian. We sign in Bulgarian.
[Valentin] Yes. [Chaid laughing] Hilarious.
I know you're fired up, man. I know I'm not--
Fuck the world! I'm gonna kill 'em all!
translation.ko: 다 필요 없어! 다 죽여버릴 거야!

translation.en: [Chaid chuckling] Oh, shit.
[Valentin] Oh, God. [Dave] This is gonna be a dark, bleak trip.
[Greg] We're talking about a triangle there.
You know, where does du Pont fit with that really close friendship triangle?
translation.ko: 듀폰은 친구 간의 삼각관계에서 어디에 속할까요?

translation.en: And du Pont was kind of outside the circle.
Yeah, he said, "Fuck the world. Kill 'em all," I think.
[Chaid laughing] Yeah, I think that was a direct quote.
-I think that was the quote. -Okay.
[Michael] He observed how people did like to gravitate towards Dave.
translation.ko: 존은 데이브 주변에 사람들이 몰리는 걸 주시했어요

translation.en: And I think that sort of got to... it got to John a little bit.
translation.ko: 그 때문에 좀 짜증 났던 것 같아요

translation.en: [Robbie] You could just tell,
because when John would go through some of his, like, fantasies,
translation.ko: 존이 자신의 환상 속으로 빠져들 때면

translation.en: sometimes he threw Dave in there.
translation.ko: 가끔 그 속에 데이브를 넣곤 했거든요

translation.en: [Ray] He believed Dave Schultz and Rob Calabrese had a weather machine
translation.ko: 존은 데이브와 로비에게 날씨 기계가 있어서

translation.en: and could control the weather.
He also got convinced there were tunnels
going into the mansion, going out of the mansion,
and that Dave Schultz used these tunnels to mess with him.
translation.ko: 데이브가 그 터널을 통해 자신을 방해한다고 확신했죠

translation.en: [Chaid] Oh, what do we have here?
[Guira] When it was, you know, getting bad, he'd be like, "There's people in the walls, and, um...
translation.ko: 상태가 안 좋을 때는 벽 속에 사람이 있는데

translation.en: I think it's Schultz," or something.
You know, he'd say something crazy like that.
translation.ko: 그런 정신 나간 말을 하곤 했어요

translation.en: And I'd say, "Dave Schultz isn't in your walls, John."
translation.ko: 그럼 저는 말했죠 ‘데이브는 벽 속에 없어요’

translation.en: [man] Show us around your room.
[Guira] We were all like brothers on the estate. We trusted each other.
Hi, there.
And du Pont, we trusted him up to a point.
But, you know, the fact that he would hire a security firm to protect him...
And he would say that he's protecting him from one of us.
translation.ko: 우리 중 하나로부터 자신을 보호하는 거라고 했어요

translation.en: [Patrick Goodale] Some friends from Secret Service contacted me and said
that John du Pont had been involved with some... threats.
And so, that's what prompted him to reach out to us.
translation.ko: 그래서 저희한테 연락한 거죠 “패트릭 구데일 폭스캐처 경비”

translation.en: [stammers] His security became an issue, and that's where things got creepy.
translation.ko: 보안 관련 문제가 생기면서 일이 꼬이기 시작했어요

translation.en: Him having these Special Force, FBI, CIA guys around him,
translation.ko: 특수부대나 FBI, CIA가 주변에 있다 보니

translation.en: John became super, hyper paranoid.
[Patrick] It was tunnels, it was mechanical trees
which he thought were built by his father as props
for garden parties.
And so whether I believe it's a fact or not,
it's worth an investigation.
So we started out with these low-level investigative efforts.
Dig a hole right there in the yard. Let's see what we find.
translation.ko: 마당에 땅을 파서 뭐가 나오는지를 보고

translation.en: Let's bring a metal detector in and see what we find.
translation.ko: 금속 탐지기도 가져와서 뭐가 나오는지 봤죠

translation.en: And then we got ever more sophisticated, as John kept insisting,
translation.ko: 존이 주장을 굽히지 않으면서 점점 정교하게 조사했어요

translation.en: and we brought in some technical equipment and some technical people.
[Robbie] They would never say, "Oh, no one's in your walls."
translation.ko: 그들은 절대 벽에 아무도 없다고 말하지 않아요

translation.en: "We'll go in your walls and look. We'll get X-rays. We'll knock the walls down."
translation.ko: 벽 속을 보고 엑스레이를 찍고 벽을 허물겠다고 하죠

translation.en: I'm like, "Why don't you just tell him no one's there?" You know?
translation.ko: 전 그냥 없다고 말하면 안 되느냐고 물었죠

translation.en: It wasn't my job to question... what his concerns were,
translation.ko: 제 일은 그에게 걱정 말라고 하는 게 아니라

translation.en: but to try to, uh, allay his fears.
In other words, to factually say,
"This individual is not a threat for these reasons."
Or, "This doesn't exist."
[Nancy] John had definitely been acting worse, acting more erratic.
translation.ko: 행동이 이상해진 것은 물론 더 변덕스러워졌어요

translation.en: It just kept getting stranger and stranger.
[Greg] During that one period of time, the color black was something bad to him.
[Robbie] He said that black was, uh, the color of death.
So he couldn't wear black shirts. He got rid of all the black horses.
translation.ko: 검은 셔츠도 입지 않았고 검은 말들을 다 처리했어요

translation.en: I had a black car, had to get rid of that.
translation.ko: 전 검은색 차가 있었는데 그것도 처분해야 했죠

translation.en: -Hey, you looking at me? -[Chaid] Yeah.
[Robbie] And then, he'd fired all the athletes that were African American off the team.
translation.ko: 심지어 흑인 선수 모두를 팀에서 퇴출했어요

translation.en: Now, we start talking.
"I mean, what's going on with this guy? Why would he do something like this?"
translation.ko: ‘왜 이러는 거지? 왜 이런 짓을 하는 거야?’

translation.en: [Greg] We talked to him about it.
You know, "You really don't want to be in this position
of being perceived as racist on this."
And he didn't buy into that and said,
"Well, it's not that. I just don't want black."
Kevin Jackson was at the peak of his game.
And to have to call him up and say, "Kevin, I got bad news for you,"
translation.ko: 그를 불러서 안 좋은 소식을 전하는 건

translation.en: was just heartbreaking.
[Kevin] Greg had explained to me, "Yeah, he won't let me drive my black van on the property.
translation.ko: 그렉 말이, 사유지에서 검은 밴을 몰지 못하게 하고

translation.en: He's kicked off Pritchett and Fisher."
And then he looks at me and says, "You, too."
And for me, I'm--
It's hard for me to believe because I'm already Olympic champion, world champion.
That's the last thing I expected.
[Kenny] When that happened with Kevin Jackson,
I felt that we should disassociate from du Pont at that point in time.
translation.ko: 이제 다들 존과의 관계를 끊을 때가 됐다고 생각했어요

translation.en: And I was just purely asking for someone to hold him accountable for his actions.
translation.ko: 그의 행동에 대해 책임을 물어 줄 사람이 필요했어요

translation.en: You got four, five black guys getting kicked off of a team
translation.ko: 최대 후원자가 네다섯 명의 흑인 선수들을

translation.en: by your main sponsor.
And nothing's done, nothing's said.
And he's still VIP, still your main guy.
translation.ko: 그는 여전히 귀하신 몸이었고 모든 것의 중심이었으니까요

translation.en: Maybe that should've been enough of a warning.
But in any case, for whatever reason, we didn't really do anything about it at that point.
translation.ko: 하지만 당시에는 이유가 뭐였건 우린 그냥 가만있었어요

translation.en: I guess, to some degree,
we were taking advantage financially of the benefits that we were getting.
translation.ko: 금전적인 혜택을 주는 존을 이용한 건지도 몰라요

translation.en: [announcer] And there it is, final team score, 21 to 15.
-United States wins the World Cup. -[cheering]
[John] Right now, it's about 2:00 in the morning.
Had to entertain you and Dave at the big house.
Lots of fun.
You know, this thing is really beautiful.
Some of the colors on it, the shine.
[Patrick] John became more and more nocturnal.
About 11:00 at night, he would get himself spun up.
And as we found out later, it was probably by virtue of chemical enhancement.
translation.ko: 나중에 알게 됐지만 약 때문이었던 것 같아요

translation.en: [Robbie] I knew that he was doing cocaine 'cause he would stay up.
translation.ko: 코카인을 하는 건 알았어요 밤을 새울 정도였거든요

translation.en: I mean, I'd be at his house stayin', and he wouldn't sleep.
translation.ko: 그의 집에 있다 보면 잠을 안 자더군요

translation.en: I could hear him up walking the halls, you know, all night.
translation.ko: 밤새도록 복도를 걷는 소리를 들을 수 있었어요

translation.en: [Guira] You know, he became obsessed.
I would, like, try and ask him about a piece of furniture,
but then he would slowly get into the wood grain of the furniture
and then actually seeing bugs or something or creatures.
[John] Whether you know it or not,
your little slime-bug friends had added to the golden gloss that it has.
translation.ko: 유령 같은 벌레가 금색 광택에 들어가 있어

translation.en: It would not have that if it had not been for them.
translation.ko: 벌레가 아니었으면 광택이 안 났을 거야

translation.en: What's this thing?
There are all sorts of friends to go with you.
[Humphrey] He thought bugs were underneath his skin.
translation.ko: 자기 피부 속에 벌레가 산다고 생각했어요

translation.en: And he would scratch until they would bleed.
And we're going, "Well, he's doing something. He's doing drugs.
You know? And he's going crazy."
Subjectively, in my observations, yeah, it got worse and worse.
Uh, he had periods there where he's walking around
in draping red clothing, saying he's the Dalai Lama.
-[baby cooing] -[Nancy] Rubber legs.
[Gene Davis] There were a few concerns that Dave shared with me
translation.ko: 데이브가 제게 걱정거리를 털어놓은 적이 있어요

translation.en: about John carrying...
um... a handgun around the place.
translation.ko: “진 데이비스 올림픽 동메달리스트” 권총을 들고 다닌다더군요

translation.en: And one time,
I think he had seen some things in the trees
and he actually shot up into the trees.
He would walk around carrying it under here, you know.
And it's like, that thing could fall and go off and hit you. [inhales sharply]
translation.ko: 그게 떨어지면서 발사되면 다칠 수도 있잖아요

translation.en: So I didn't like to be around him when he was carrying his gun around.
translation.ko: 그가 총을 갖고 있을 땐 근처에 가기 싫었어요

translation.en: [Robbie] Every day, when I'd drive the ten miles to Foxcatcher,
the closer I got, the more nervous I got.
I'm getting nervous to where I'm shaking going into work.
translation.ko: 일하러 가는데 몸이 벌벌 떨리는 거예요

translation.en: [Greg] We called it the solar system at the farm.
You know, the big house being the sun,
and the closer you got to the sun, the more likely you were to get burnt.
translation.ko: 태양에 가까워질수록 화상 입을 가능성이 커졌어요

translation.en: So, really, the athletes tried to not get too close to the sun.
translation.ko: 선수들은 태양 근처에 가지 않으려고 했죠

translation.en: [Michael] But then there's a group of guys that really cared about John.
translation.ko: 하지만 존을 정말 걱정하던 사람들이 있었어요

translation.en: [Eric] Robbie and Dave were the ones who would go talk to him and say,
translation.ko: 로비와 데이브는 존에게 직접 말하기도 했죠

translation.en: "Are you okay? What's going on?"
[Robbie] We approached him and said, "John, you're getting way too paranoid."
translation.ko: 우리는 존에게 가서 너무 피해망상적이라고 했어요

translation.en: We talked to Dr. Gostigian about it, and he said
there's probably just chemical imbalance here.
It could probably be fixed with medicine.
And we went and told him that, and he got really mad.
He said, "I'm fine. There's nothing wrong with me.
You guys just don't believe me."
[Ed] Things just started going south real quick.
And then he started the whole thing with Dan.
[Chaid] This is my house from the backside.
[Brinzer] When things really started to go down, Dan was close to the center.
translation.ko: 상황이 악화할 무렵 댄은 그 중심에 있었어요

translation.en: [Chaid] I was living there on the farm, and then...
Not even through John's own words, but through his attorney, that,
"John wants you to move off the estate."
Well, that was a little bit of a bitter pill to swallow.
[Robbie] John initially told Dan to leave the farm.
Dan didn't do it right away,
so John had a U-Haul brought to his house and parked it in front.
translation.ko: 이삿짐 트럭을 불러서 댄의 집 앞에 세워뒀어요

translation.en: And it just sat there.
[Chaid] "Move yourself and save."
Okay.
[Dave] Hey, we got some wild maniac down this way a bit.
[Chaid] I was in the weight room lifting, and he came in with the gun.
He walked up to me
and he gets the gun and points it at my chest,
he goes, "Don't you...with me! I want you off this farm!"
And I just shrunk my head, and I showed him the palms of my hands,
translation.ko: 머리를 숙이고는 제 손바닥을 보이며 말했죠

translation.en: and I just said, "John, I don't know what this is all about. I've only tried to be your friend."
translation.ko: ‘왜 그러시는지 모르겠어요 친구가 되려 했을 뿐인데요’

translation.en: And it was just enough, he backed up,
he put the gun down and then he ran back to the big house.
[Chaid] There's that beautiful-looking eagle.
[Robbie] And Dan's like, "du Pont just pulled a gun on me,
stuck it to my chest and said, 'Get off the farm!'" [chuckles]
But... that's typical stuff.
[Chaid] You know, a lot of people made a joke out of it.
I called the police.
I told them John had pulled a machine gun on me, and he laughed.
translation.ko: 존이 제게 총을 겨눴다고 말했더니 웃더군요

translation.en: He said, "Well, I've known John a long time. He's always been a little different."

[John] All right. I'll go out the garden door.
translation.ko: 좋아, 정원 쪽 문으로 나갈 거야

translation.en: [man] Okay, are you going to be armed?
[John] No. [man] Okay.
Please don't come out armed, okay?
[John] No, I won't. [man] Okay.
[John] All right, I will be dressed in black.
[man] You're dressed in black.
[John] With my Bulgarian colors showing the flag.
translation.ko: 내 불가리아 깃발을 상징하는 색도 보일 거고

translation.en: Members of the mansion must move back. You must move back.
Then over the radios we hear, "He's coming out, he's coming out."
translation.ko: 무전기를 통해 그가 나온다는 말을 들었어요

translation.en: He then exits the back door of the property
and starts walking towards the greenhouse.
An officer came out from behind a tree, started giving him commands.
translation.ko: 나무 뒤에서 경찰이 나와서 그에게 명령을 내렸어요

translation.en: He kind of threw his hands up and then put them down and then up,
translation.ko: 두 손을 들었다가 다시 내렸다가 또 들고는

translation.en: and kind of turned back towards the house.
A fast officer by the name of Officer Lunn chased him down.
It's my understanding there was a tackle involved, but, uh, that was it.
translation.ko: 약간 몸싸움이 있었던 것으로 알고 있지만 그게 답니다

translation.en: [newscaster] Tonight, the nearly 50-hour stand-off on the grounds of the du Pont estate
translation.ko: 델라웨어 카운티의 듀폰 가에서 50시간가량 이어진 교착상태가

translation.en: in Delaware County has ended.
John du Pont walked out of his mansion and was apprehended by police.
translation.ko: 존 듀폰이 저택을 나와 경찰에 체포되었습니다

translation.en: He is in jail tonight, charged with murdering wrestler Dave Schultz.
translation.ko: 데이브 슐츠 살인 혐의로 오늘 밤을 감옥에서 보냅니다

translation.en: [Nancy] It was very surreal.
There's almost a fogginess around some of the memories that
it doesn't feel like-- It's almost like an out-of-body experience.
You almost feel like you're watching it or something,
completely not knowing which end is up and life had fallen apart.
translation.ko: 혼란스러웠고 삶이 다 무너져내리는 것 같았어요

translation.en: Life had literally fallen apart.
translation.ko: 말 그대로 삶이 다 무너진 것 같았죠

translation.en: [Robbie stutters] I'm angry. I was--
I could've seen it coming or could've did something about it.
translation.ko: 예측할 수도 있었고 조처를 할 수도 있었으니까요

translation.en: It's just sad that, you know, Dave had to die.
For what?
[Jim] You know, the sport was shocked back to reality
translation.ko: 스포츠계는 이 현실에 대해 충격을 받았어요

translation.en: that while this happened, everybody who knew Dave,
everybody who knew what was going on,
everybody who had some thought of what might be going on,
translation.ko: 어떤 일이 벌어질지 예상 가능했던 사람들

translation.en: we all have some part to blame, some guilt to carry.
translation.ko: 모두의 잘못이었고 다들 죄책감을 짊어지게 됐죠

translation.en: [Guira] If Dave had left, well, then who's gonna keep it together?
I'm sure he felt a responsibility, also to people like me who--
He, like, basically pledged to me that... "Everything will be fine.
Du Pont will do what he says.
We're gonna... we're gonna train and make the Olympic team."
So...
He achieved everything there was to achieve in wrestling.
And most of all, and you've heard it repeatedly,
he was a great friend to his teammates... and, really, to everyone that he knew.
translation.ko: 그는 동료들에게는 물론 모두에게 훌륭한 친구였습니다

translation.en: I felt like Dave was a best friend.
But I also acknowledge he had about a thousand of those best friends,
translation.ko: 하지만 저 같은 친구가 천 명은 있었죠

translation.en: that anybody who developed a relationship with Dave,
that's how you felt.
You felt like the most important person to Dave.
translation.ko: 자신이 데이브에게 가장 중요한 사람처럼 느껴지는 거죠

translation.en: It was really a unique skill.
[Valentin] My best friend is gone forever.
But the memory... will stay with me.
It was the six best years of my life.
[Alexander voice breaking] You know, as much as people have so many great stories about him
translation.ko: 사람들은 아버지에 관한 훌륭한 일화를 말하면서

translation.en: and came to know him and who he was, I don't.
translation.ko: 어떤 분인지 잘 안다고 하지만 저는 그렇지 못해요

translation.en: [sighs] That's the shittiest part.
[Nancy] While I have no idea
why John committed this senseless and brutal killing of my husband,
translation.ko: 이렇게도 무분별하고 끔찍하게 남편을 죽였는지는 모르겠지만

translation.en: I am confident that the police and the authorities
translation.ko: 저는 경찰과 당국이 철저한 조사를 통해

translation.en: will conduct a thorough investigation and bring him to justice.
[Tom] There was never any factual disputes in terms of what took place.
translation.ko: 사건 자체에 대해서는 어떤 이의도 없었어요

translation.en: I mean, there was never a doubt that John du Pont killed Dave Schultz.
translation.ko: 존 듀폰이 죽였다는 데는 의심의 여지가 없었죠

translation.en: That really wasn't the issue.
Uh, the issue was obviously gonna be a mental health issue.
[Dennis McAndrews] The defense plea was not guilty by reason of insanity.
translation.ko: “정신과 의사들, 듀폰이 진짜 정신병 환자라는 의견” 피고 측은 정신질환에 의한 사고라며 무죄를 주장했어요

translation.en: If accepted by a jury, results in an acquittal.
translation.ko: 배심원들이 인정할 경우 무죄를 선고받게 돼요

translation.en: He can walk out the door.
[Joe] Once they raised the claim, the burden was on the prosecution
to demonstrate that the defendant is, uh, not insane.
translation.ko: 존이 정신 이상이 아니라는 걸 증명해야 했습니다

translation.en: And with someone like du Pont, that was a real problem
because this is a person whose behavior
would cause an average person they heard about him say,
translation.ko: 증언할 수 있는 사람이 많았기 때문에

translation.en: "That guy is crazy. He's insane."
[Will] There became a division right after that took place
and there were camps. I mean, there was definitely two camps.
You were either on the side of Dave Schultz
or you were on the side of John du Pont.
[Taras Wochok] At this time in his life when he really needs some support...
translation.ko: 그를 옹호해줄 사람이 필요한 이 순간에...

translation.en: uh, much of that support has either, uh, dissipated or evaporated
translation.ko: “타라스 워촉 듀폰의 개인 변호사” 대부분이 그런 마음을 접고

translation.en: or just simply left him.
[Ed] Du Pont's attorney, Wochok, contacts all of us
and wants us to come in and meet with him in his office.
[Stearne] I got offered to come back to be the athletic trainer.
translation.ko: 저는 선수 트레이너로 복귀해달라는 요청을 받았죠

translation.en: "We wanna start Foxcatcher up again
in respect to Dave and Nancy, and, you know, we'll double your salary."
translation.ko: 데이브 사건도 있으니 월급을 두 배로 주겠다더군요

translation.en: I just... I wanted to walk out right then. I couldn't even look at the guy.
translation.ko: 그냥 떠나고 싶었어요 꼴도 보기 싫었죠

translation.en: You know, I just... Does he think we're that stupid?
[Ray] Nancy wanted everybody to desert, basically.
She certainly didn't want... [sighs] him supported... by us any...
translation.ko: 우리가 존을 어떤 식으로든 지지하는 걸 원치 않았죠

translation.en: It was... it was hard because... you know, you got the wrestlers...
[stammers] That was my life.
That was like a family there, and it's gone.
translation.ko: 가족이나 다름없었는데 그게 사라지고 만 거예요

translation.en: I had a house there I couldn't really leave.
translation.ko: 집도 거기에 있었으니 떠날 수가 없었죠

translation.en: Yeah, I just...
[stammers] Everybody's gotta make their own decisions, right?
I could've stayed. A lot of people did stay.
translation.ko: 저도 많은 선수처럼 남을 수도 있었어요

translation.en: [Valentin in Bulgarian] It was a very difficult period.
Nobody knew...
where they would go.
In Bulgaria, during that time,
there was political unrest and the government was unstable.
My first thought was how I was going to make it...
translation.ko: 가장 먼저 떠올랐던 생각은 ‘내 가족과 아이들을’

translation.en: My family and my kids...
how can I give them the best possible education and upbringing?
translation.ko: ‘어떻게 하면 최고의 교육과 생활을 제공할 수 있을까’

translation.en: [Nancy] My mother and father. Say hello.
-Ha-ha. Hello. -[Nancy chuckles]
Ah, Arina.
[Alexander] The Dimitrovs were the closest family we had on the farm.
They lived with us.
-[Nancy] Danny! -Bye-bye.
-Bye, Nancy. -[Nancy] Bye-bye.
[Alexander] And then after my dad was killed, we just went our separate ways.
translation.ko: 아버지가 돌아가신 뒤에는 각자의 길을 갔어요

translation.en: Valo, he didn't support us.
You know, he wasn't there... for us after that.
[Nancy] Okay, Tig, you're on.
[Alexander] I don't think it was like any dark intentions or like,
"I wanna help du Pont get free," or anything like that.
translation.ko: 듀폰의 석방을 돕는다거나 그런 건 아니었지만

translation.en: But I understood that if the right motivating factors are there,
people can be temporary in your life.
translation.ko: 사람 관계는 끊어질 수 있나 봐요

translation.en: No matter how big they are for a moment, they can be temporary.
translation.ko: 아무리 영향력이 컸다 해도 잠시의 인연으로 끝나는 거죠

translation.en: Opening statements are to begin today
in the murder trial of multi-millionaire John du Pont.
translation.ko: 살인 공판을 위한 진술이 오늘 시작됩니다

translation.en: [Tom] I'd never been involved in a case where there was that much financial support.
translation.ko: 사건에 금전적인 지원이 그렇게 많은 건 처음이었어요

translation.en: We were able to do focus groups. We did two of them.
We had some of the best psychiatrists, probably, in the world.
translation.ko: 거의 세계 최고 수준의 심리학자들도 참여했죠

translation.en: [McAndrews] As the case unfolded,
the defense strategy appeared to be very strong.
translation.ko: 피고 측의 전략은 정말 대단해 보였습니다

translation.en: On the day of the murder, John du Pont was clean shaven,
translation.ko: 사건 당일 존 듀폰은 말끔하게 면도를 했고

translation.en: his hair was short, he was dressed appropriately.
translation.ko: 짧은 머리에 적절하게 옷을 갖춰 입었죠

translation.en: And from that day forward,
he grew a long beard, he grew his hair long,
and you've got the jury seeing him being wheeled in and out of court
translation.ko: 배심원 앞에서는 법정으로 휠체어를 타고 다니며

translation.en: looking more and more disheveled and crazy with each passing month.
translation.ko: 시간이 지날수록 부스스하고 정신 나간듯한 모습을 보였죠

translation.en: So we were very, very concerned.
Three, two and... one.
If the jury of six men and six women finds du Pont not guilty by reason of insanity,
translation.ko: 남녀 각각 6명으로 구성된 배심원이 무죄를 선고할 경우

translation.en: he would be held in a mental hospital
until doctors decided he was no longer a danger to society.
translation.ko: 의사의 소견이 나올 때까지 정신 병원에 수용됩니다

translation.en: Then he could go free.
[newscaster] They ended the seventh day of deliberations and still no verdict.
[McAndrews] The jury deliberations were excruciating.
translation.ko: 배심원 평결을 기다리는 건 정말 괴로운 일이었죠

translation.en: Any time you try a case,
you're hoping that the jury is gonna come back relatively quickly.
translation.ko: 배심원 평결이 조금만 빨리 나길 바라곤 해요

translation.en: But they kept asking questions and kept deliberating.
I was scared that he was gonna get out and come kill us.
translation.ko: 그가 풀려나서 우리를 죽일까 봐 두려웠어요

translation.en: Hello, and now my eye.
[Danielle] Because I don't know why he did it in the first place.
So, you think you can escape my clutches?
I'm coming to get you.
Almost there, children.
[newscaster] Chopper six saw the vans pulling the jury to the courthouse.
translation.ko: 법원으로 가는 배심원 차량을 6번 헬기가 포착했습니다

translation.en: [Tom] I would like to be able to say to him
that at some point he will go home again.
translation.ko: 어느 시점이 되면 귀가할 수 있을 거라고요

translation.en: Tuesday night and the big story in Action News tonight is the fate of John du Pont.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 존 듀폰의 운명을 특집으로 보도합니다

translation.en: [newscaster] The question, "Did John du Pont shoot David Schultz?"
translation.ko: ‘존 듀폰이 데이브 슐츠에게 총을 쏜 건 맞습니까?’

translation.en: The answer, "Yes."
"Do you find him guilty in the third degree?" "Yes."
John du Pont is going away for a long time, guilty of murder.
I think people thought that he might use money to triumph over justice.
translation.ko: 존 듀폰이 돈으로 정의를 살 거로 생각하셨을 겁니다

translation.en: Well, that did not occur.
[newscaster] Dave Schultz's widow, Nancy, laid her head on her father's shoulder
translation.ko: 데이브 슐츠의 미망인은 평결을 읽어내리는 동안

translation.en: when the verdict was read.
It is the end of a yearlong struggle for justice.
translation.ko: 정의를 위한 1년간의 사투가 이렇게 막을 내렸습니다

translation.en: It is comforting to know that du Pont is not above the law,
translation.ko: 듀폰이 법의 심판을 받았다니 위안이 됩니다

translation.en: and he must now be held responsible for David's murder.
I'm relieved that the criminal trial is over.
I look forward to returning to California and focusing my attention on my family.
[Nancy] When he was in prison,
John du Pont had a bunch of the pieces of property
painted black here on the estate. The houses were painted black.
And basically, it was just 'cause he was depressed and everything,
so he just painted the estate to look like he was suffering in the prison.
translation.ko: 사유지를 통해 자신의 고통을 표현하고 싶었나 봐요

translation.en: [Danielle] I was flying to Chicago and someone had a newspaper next to me
translation.ko: 시카고로 비행 중이었는데 옆 사람이 보고 있던 신문에

translation.en: and in the newspaper it said,
John du Pont dies in jail at whatever age he was at.
translation.ko: 몇 살인지는 몰라도 존 듀폰이 감옥에서 죽었다고요

translation.en: And I was like, "Can I see that?"
translation.ko: 저는 그 신문을 좀 보여달라고 했죠

translation.en: I was relieved.
I mean, I didn't wanna worry about it anymore.
I didn't want him to sit in a jail for the rest of his life.
translation.ko: 그가 평생 감옥에서 썩길 바란 건 아니었지만요

translation.en: But I was so sad because everyone was so happy that he died.
translation.ko: 그래도 다들 그의 죽음에 기뻐하는 건 좀 슬펐어요

translation.en: And I just thought it was so unfair.
I mean, when my dad died, everyone mourned.
And this guy never had anybody to love him.
And then he died and everyone's happy?
It's just sad.
[Robbie] You like this plane, Valo?
[Dave] It's the plane. He likes it.
[Chaid] Nice plane!
translation.ko: 비행기 좋네요! “발렌틴 요다노프는 존 듀폰의 1차 상속인으로 지명됐다”

translation.en: [in Bulgarian] Most of the time I'm sad because of the situation,
and where we are now, at this moment.
Alexander and the family will always be close to me.
translation.ko: 알렉산더와 가족들은 항상 제 곁에 있을 거예요

translation.en: The Schultz's will always stay close to my heart.
translation.ko: 슐츠 가족은 항상 제 마음속에 있을 겁니다

translation.en: [chuckles] This is Danny's nursery when she was first born.
[Nancy] Hi, Danny! -Good morning! -[Danielle coos]
She just woke up!
Says, "Let me out of here, Mom."
And then this was our room over here, and it's really fallen apart.
These are boxes from when we first moved in.
translation.ko: 처음 이사 왔을 때 사용했던 상자예요

translation.en: Look, there's "Alexander's bedroom."
[Alexander] Alexander Schultz.
[Nancy] Very good, and how old are you? [Alexander] Three.
[Nancy] Who's your daddy?
-[Alexander] Uh, David. -[Nancy laughs]
[Dave chuckling] He got it correct.
[Dave] Alexander is getting ready for his first day for school.
What are you thinking here on your first day at school?
translation.ko: 첫 등교 날에 무슨 생각 하니?

translation.en: [Alexander] Bad. [Dave] Bad?
Anything else? Can you expand on that?
translation.ko: 다른 건 없어? 좀 더 자세히 말해줄래?

translation.en: [Alexander] No.
[Danielle] Hi, Mom.
-Hi, Mom. -[Alexander] Hi, Mom.
-I'm-- -[Nancy] Hi, guys.
-Mommy! -Hi, Mom.
Now, do you think that this is a pig or dog?
[Nancy] This?
-This is a what? -[Nancy] That's Nicky.
What is Nicky? A pig or a dog?
[Nancy] A pig-dog.
-[Alexander] No, no, no. -Dog.
-Is this a pig or a dog? -Dog.
-Dog? -Dog.
Dog, Mommy.
